---
title: "A Brief Introduction to NOMA"
data: 2019-9-2
tags: "NOMA"
---
<div class="output_wrapper" id="output_wrapper_id" style="font-size: 16px; color: rgb(62, 62, 62); line-height: 1.6; word-spacing: 0px; letter-spacing: 0px; font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, 'Hiragino Sans GB', 'Microsoft YaHei', Arial, sans-serif;"><h1 id="habriefintroductiontonoma" style="color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.6em;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">A Brief Introduction to NOMA</span></h1>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">5G is expected to satisfy the requirements of a low latency, low cost and support of diverse compelling devices. Over the past few decades, wireless communication systems have witnessed a “revolution” in terms of their multiple access techniques. For the conventional wireless communication techniques systems frequency division multiple access (FDMA), time division multiple access (TDMA), code division multiple access (CDMA). From the perspective of their design principles, these multiple access schemes belong to the category of orthogonal multiple access (OMA).<br>Non-orthogonal multiple access (NOMA) is an innovative concept in 5G, which can support more users than the number of available orthogonal TDMA, FDMA or code-domain resources. </p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">The basic idea of NOMA is to support non-orthogonal orthogonal resource allocation among the users at the ultimate cost of increase receive complexity, which is required for separating the non-orthogonal signals. </p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">Recently several NOMA solutions have been actively investigated, which can be basically divided into two main categories, namely power-domain NOMA and code-domain NOMA.</p>
<h2 id="hadvantagesofnomacomparedtooma" style="line-height: inherit; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.4em; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-right: 5px; padding: 8px 15px; letter-spacing: 2px; background-image: linear-gradient(to right bottom, rgb(0, 188, 212), rgb(63, 81, 181)); background-color: rgb(63, 81, 181); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-left: 10px solid rgb(51, 51, 51); border-radius: 5px; text-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 1px; box-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 2px;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Advantages of NOMA Compared to OMA</span></h2>
<ul style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; padding-left: 32px; list-style-type: disc;">
<li style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Improved spectral efficiency and cell -edge throughput</span></li>
<li style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Massive connectivity</span></li>
<li style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Low transmission latency and signaling cost</span></li>
<li style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Relaxed channel feedback</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 id="hpowerdomainnoma" style="line-height: inherit; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.4em; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-right: 5px; padding: 8px 15px; letter-spacing: 2px; background-image: linear-gradient(to right bottom, rgb(0, 188, 212), rgb(63, 81, 181)); background-color: rgb(63, 81, 181); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-left: 10px solid rgb(51, 51, 51); border-radius: 5px; text-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 1px; box-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 2px;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Power-domain NOMA</span></h2>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">At the transmitter, different signals generated by different users are directly superimposed on each other after classic channel coding and modulation. Multiple users share the same time-frequency resources, and then are detected at the receivers by MUD algorithms such as SIC. In this way, the spectral efficienc can be enhanced at the cost of an increased receiver complexity compared to conventional OMA.</p>
<h3 id="hsuccessiveinterferencecancellationsic" style="line-height: inherit; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.3em; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-right: 5px; padding: 8px 15px; letter-spacing: 2px; background-image: linear-gradient(to right bottom, rgb(0, 188, 212), rgb(63, 81, 181)); background-color: rgb(63, 81, 181); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-left: 10px solid rgb(51, 51, 51); border-radius: 5px; text-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 1px; box-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 2px;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Successive Interference Cancellation (SIC)</span></h3>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">SIC is a decoding method in power-domain NOMA, which the user with strong channel conditions are capable of removing the interference of weak users. </p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">Without loss of generality, assume that the users are ordered based on their channel quality, i.e.,</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;"><span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span></p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">The use of NOMA implies <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span>, with <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span>. Conventional detection will be carried out at the K-th user at the end of the phase. </p>
<ul style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; padding-left: 32px; list-style-type: disc;">
<li style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em;"><p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">Downlink NOMA: The strong interfering signals are mainly due to the high power message signals og relatively weak channel users. As such, to extract the desired signal, each user cancels the strong interferences by successively decoding, remodulating, and subtracting them<br>from the received signal x. Subsequently, the highest channel gain user cancels all intra-cluster interferences, whereas the lowest channel gain user receives the interferences from all users within its cluster.</p></li>
<li style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; margin-bottom: 0.5em;"><p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">Uplink NOMA: Different from the downlink NOMA, the signal is decoded first at the BS and experiences interference from all users in the cluster with relatively weaker channels. That is, the transmission of the highest channel gain user experiences interference from all users within its cluster, whereas the transmission of the lowest channel gain user receives zero interference from the users in its cluster.</p></li>
</ul>
<h3 id="hdirecttransmissionphase" style="line-height: inherit; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.3em; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-right: 5px; padding: 8px 15px; letter-spacing: 2px; background-image: linear-gradient(to right bottom, rgb(0, 188, 212), rgb(63, 81, 181)); background-color: rgb(63, 81, 181); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-left: 10px solid rgb(51, 51, 51); border-radius: 5px; text-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 1px; box-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 2px;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Direct Transmission Phase</span></h3>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">Consider a broadcast channel with one base station and <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span> user.</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">The base station sends <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span> messages to the destinations based on the NOMA principle i.e., the base station sends <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span>, where the <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span> is the message for the m-th user, and <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span> is the power allocation coefficient for the user. </p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">The observation at the k-th user is given by </p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;"><span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span>,</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">where <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span> denotes the Rayleigh fading channel coefficient from the base station to the k-th user and <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span> denotes the additive Gaussian noise. </p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">The received signal to interference plus noise ratio (SINR) for the base station k and n-th device can be expressed as follows:</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;"><span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span>.</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">With the use of SIC, the SINR between base station k and device n can be expressed as follow:</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;"><span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span>.</p>
<h3 id="htransmissionrate" style="line-height: inherit; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.3em; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-right: 5px; padding: 8px 15px; letter-spacing: 2px; background-image: linear-gradient(to right bottom, rgb(0, 188, 212), rgb(63, 81, 181)); background-color: rgb(63, 81, 181); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-left: 10px solid rgb(51, 51, 51); border-radius: 5px; text-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 1px; box-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 2px;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Transmission Rate</span></h3>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">The transmission rate between base station k and n-th user can be calculated as</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;"><span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span>.</p>
<h3 id="hcooperativetransmissionphase" style="line-height: inherit; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.3em; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-right: 5px; padding: 8px 15px; letter-spacing: 2px; background-image: linear-gradient(to right bottom, rgb(0, 188, 212), rgb(63, 81, 181)); background-color: rgb(63, 81, 181); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-left: 10px solid rgb(51, 51, 51); border-radius: 5px; text-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 1px; box-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 2px;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Cooperative Transmission Phase</span></h3>
<h4 id="hcooperativesinr" style="color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.2em;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Cooperative SINR</span></h4>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">The SINR between base station k and n-th user, can be calculated as</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;"><span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span>.</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">Comparing the direct transmission SINR to the cooperation transmission SINR, we can see that the use of cooperation can boost reception reliability.</p>
<h2 id="hmorespecific" style="line-height: inherit; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.4em; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-right: 5px; padding: 8px 15px; letter-spacing: 2px; background-image: linear-gradient(to right bottom, rgb(0, 188, 212), rgb(63, 81, 181)); background-color: rgb(63, 81, 181); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-left: 10px solid rgb(51, 51, 51); border-radius: 5px; text-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 1px; box-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 2px;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">More specific</span></h2>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">When we are considering a wireless communication scenery, there are some coefficient that may affect the transmission rate.</p>
<h3 id="hchannelgain" style="line-height: inherit; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.3em; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-right: 5px; padding: 8px 15px; letter-spacing: 2px; background-image: linear-gradient(to right bottom, rgb(0, 188, 212), rgb(63, 81, 181)); background-color: rgb(63, 81, 181); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-left: 10px solid rgb(51, 51, 51); border-radius: 5px; text-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 1px; box-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 2px;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Channel Gain</span></h3>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">Channel gain is the coefficient that imply the quality of the channel. In a wireless communication channel, the transmitted signal can travel from transmitter to receiver over multiple reflective paths. This gives rise to multipath fading which causes fluctuations in amplitude, phase and angle of arrival of the received signal. For example, the transmitted signal from the base station may suffer multiple reflections from the buildings nearby, before reaching the base station.</p>
<h4 id="hrayleighfading" style="color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.2em;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Rayleigh Fading</span></h4>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">Rayleigh fading is viewed as a reasonable model for tropospheric and ionospheric signal propagation as well as the effect of heavily built-up urban environments on radio signals. Rayleigh fading is most applicable when there is no dominant propagation along a line of sight between the transmitter and receiver.</p>
<h4 id="hricianfading" style="color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.2em;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Rician Fading</span></h4>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">Rician fading is stochastic model for radio propagation in which there is Line of Sight(LoS) component present in the signal.</p>
<h3 id="hpathloss" style="line-height: inherit; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.3em; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-right: 5px; padding: 8px 15px; letter-spacing: 2px; background-image: linear-gradient(to right bottom, rgb(0, 188, 212), rgb(63, 81, 181)); background-color: rgb(63, 81, 181); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-left: 10px solid rgb(51, 51, 51); border-radius: 5px; text-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 1px; box-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 2px;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Path Loss</span></h3>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">The large-scale path loss can be computed in different ways due to different sceneries. There is a popular way to compute it as</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;"><span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span>,</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">where <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span> is the pass loss factor adjusted according to different sceneries.</p>
<h3 id="hthermalnoisepower" style="line-height: inherit; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.3em; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-right: 5px; padding: 8px 15px; letter-spacing: 2px; background-image: linear-gradient(to right bottom, rgb(0, 188, 212), rgb(63, 81, 181)); background-color: rgb(63, 81, 181); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-left: 10px solid rgb(51, 51, 51); border-radius: 5px; text-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 1px; box-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 2px;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Thermal Noise Power</span></h3>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">-174dBm/Hz is the absolute value of thermal noise power of resistance at room temperature (20℃). The background noise power <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span> for bandwide <span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span> can be computed as<br><span class="katex" style="font: 1.21em/1.2 KaTeX_Main, 'Times New Roman', serif; text-indent: 0px; text-rendering: auto; font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 8px 3px;"><img src="data:image/png;base64," style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 0px auto; max-width: 100%; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;"></span>.</p>
<h3 id="hspectralefficiency" style="line-height: inherit; margin: 1.5em 0px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 1.3em; margin-bottom: 2em; margin-right: 5px; padding: 8px 15px; letter-spacing: 2px; background-image: linear-gradient(to right bottom, rgb(0, 188, 212), rgb(63, 81, 181)); background-color: rgb(63, 81, 181); color: rgb(255, 255, 255); border-left: 10px solid rgb(51, 51, 51); border-radius: 5px; text-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 1px; box-shadow: rgb(102, 102, 102) 1px 1px 2px;"><span style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; margin: 0px; padding: 0px;">Spectral efficiency</span></h3>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">Spectral efficiency refers to the information rate that can be transmitted over a given bandwidth in a specific communication system. It is a measure of how efficiently a limited frequency spectrum is utilized by the physical layer protocol, and sometimes by the media access control (the channel access protocol).</p>
<p style="font-size: inherit; color: inherit; line-height: inherit; padding: 0px; margin: 1.5em 0px;">The spectral efficiency for 4G cellular is 5 bits/s/Hz. whereas the spectral efficiency of 5G cellular is 5~15 times as much as 4G theoretically.</p></div>
